Company (as defined in Rule 12b-2 of the Exchange Act). Yes&#160;<font 
style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: 
wingdings">o</font>&#160;&#160;&#160;No&#160;<font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">The aggregate market value of the voting and non-voting common 
equity held by non-affiliates of the registrant as of July 31, 2012 was 
$60,008,628 based upon the price of $1.50 at which the common stock was last 
sold as of the last business day of the most recently completed second fiscal 
quarter, multiplied by the approximate number of shares of common stock held by 
persons other than executive officers, directors and five percent stockholders 
of the registrant without conceding that any such person is an "affiliate" of 
the registrant for purposes of the federal securities laws. Our common stock is 
traded in the over-the-counter market and quoted on the Over-The-Counter 
Bulletin Board under the symbol ("HMNC").</font></div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; 
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&#160;</font></div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman; 
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">As of October 5, 2012, the registrant's outstanding stock 
consisted of 83,730,667 common shares.</font></div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman; 
FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">EXPLANATORY NOTE</font></div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; 
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&#160;</font></div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify">
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">This Amendment No. 3 on Form 10-K/A amends the Company&#8217;s 
Annual Report on Form 10-K for the year ended July 31, 2012, as filed with the 
Securities and Exchange Commission (the &#8220;SEC&#8221;) on November 9, 2012 
(the &#8220;Original Filing&#8221;) and Amendment No. 1 and No. 2 to the 
Original Filing as filed with the SEC on December 21, 2012 and on August 20, 
2013, respectively.</font></div>
<br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify">
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">The purpose of this Amendment No. 3 on Form 10-K/A is to 
respond to certain comments received from the Staff of the SEC. &#160;For 
convenience and ease of reference, the Company is filing this Form 10-K/A in its
entirety with all applicable changes and unless otherwise stated, all 
information contained in this amendment is as of November 9, 2012, the filing 
date of the Original Filing. Except as stated herein, this Form 10-K/A does not 
reflect events or transactions occurring after such filing date or modify or 
update those disclosures in the original Form 10-K that may have been affected 
by events or transactions occurring subsequent to such filing date.</font></div>

</td>
<td align="left" valign="top" width="77%">

<div id="HDR">
<div id="GLHDR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="right"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; 
FONT-FAMILY: times new roman; FONT-SIZE: 8pt">&#160; </font></div>
</div>
</div>
<div><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 
10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">&#160;</font></div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times
new roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">FORWARD-LOOKING 
STATEMENTS</font></div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">This Amended Annual Report on Form 10-K/A of Hondo Minerals 
Corporation, a Nevada corporation, contains "forward-looking statements," as 
defined in the United States Private Securities Litigation Reform Act of 1995. 
In some cases, you can identify forward-looking statements by terminology such 
as "may", "will", "should", "could", "expects", "plans", "intends", 
"anticipates", "believes", "estimates", "predicts", "potential" or "continue" or
the negative of such terms and other comparable terminology. These forward-
looking statements include, without limitation, statements about our market 
opportunity, our strategies, competition, expected activities and expenditures 
as we pursue our business plan, and the adequacy of our available cash 
resources. Although we believe that the expectations reflected in the forward-
looking statements are reasonable, we cannot guarantee future results, levels of
activity, performance or achievements. Actual results may differ materially from
the predictions discussed in these forward-looking statements. The economic 
environment within which we operate could materially affect our actual results. 
Additional factors that could materially affect these forward-looking statements
and/or predictions include, among other things: the volatility of minerals 
prices, the possibility that exploration efforts will not yield economically 
recoverable quantities of minerals, accidents and other risks associated with 
mineral exploration and development activities, the risk that the Company will 
encounter unanticipated geological factors, the Company's need for and ability 
to obtain additional financing, the possibility that the Company may not be able
to secure permitting and other governmental clearances necessary to carry out 
the Company's exploration and development plans, the exercise of the 
approximately 72.8% control the Company's two officers and directors 
collectively hold of the Company's voting securities, other factors over which 
we have little or no control; and other factors discussed in the Company's 
filings with the Securities and Exchange Commission ("SEC").</font></div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Our management has included projections and estimates in this 
Form 10-K/A, which are based primarily on management's experience in the 
industry, assessments of our results of operations, discussions and negotiations
with third parties and a review of information filed by our competitors with the
SEC or otherwise publicly available. The Company is currently an exploration 
stage company and will continue to be an exploration stage company until we have
established mineral reserves (defined herein). There is no assurance that a 
commercially viable mineral deposit exists on any of our properties and further 
exploration will be required before a final evaluation as to the economic and 
legal feasibility is determined. We caution readers not to place undue reliance 
on any such forward-looking statements, which speak only as of the date made. We
disclaim any obligation subsequently to revise any forward-looking statements to
reflect events or circumstances after the date of such statements or to reflect 
the occurrence of anticipated or unanticipated events.</font></div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">All references in this Form 10-K/A to the "Company", "Hondo", 
"we", "us," or "our" are to Hondo Minerals Corporation, unless otherwise 
specified.</font></div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>
<div id="PGBRK" style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt">
<div id="FTR">
<div id="GLFTR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; 
FONT-FAMILY: times new roman; FONT-SIZE: 8pt">&#160; </font></div>
</div>
<div id="PN" style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always; WIDTH: 100%">
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: center; WIDTH: 100%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-
FAMILY: times new roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">3</font></div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: center; WIDTH: 100%">
<hr style="COLOR: black" noshade size="2">
</div>
</div>
<div id="HDR">
<div id="GLHDR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="right"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; 
FONT-FAMILY: times new roman; FONT-SIZE: 8pt">&#160; </font></div>
</div>
</div>
<div><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 
10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">&#160;</font></div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times
new roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><a name="A001">PART 
I</a></font></div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman; 
FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><a name="A002">ITEM 
1.&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;BUSINESS</a></font
></div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman; 
FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: 
bold">I.&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;<font 
style="DISPLAY: inline; TEXT-DECORATION: underline">ORGANIZATION WITHIN THE LAST
FIVE YEARS</font></font></div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">We are a forward-thinking, innovative and dynamic mining 
Company with headquarters in Addison, Texas. We were incorporated under the laws
of the State of Nevada on September 25, 2007. We are engaged in the acquisition 
of mines, mining claims, and mining real estate in the United States, Canada and
Mexico.</font></div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">On February 8, 2011, Tycore Ventures, Inc., closed a 
transaction pursuant to that certain Share Exchange Agreement (the "Share 
Exchange Agreement") with Hondo Minerals, Inc., a Nevada corporation ("HMI") and
the shareholders of HMI (the "HMI Shareholders"), whereby the Company acquired 
100% of the outstanding shares of common stock of HMI (the "HMI Stock") from HMI
Shareholders. By agreement and after cancellations, Tycore exchanged 17,783,888 
shares of its common stock for all of the issued and outstanding common shares 
of HMI. As a result of closing the transaction, HMI Shareholders then held 
approximately 76% of the Company's issued and outstanding common stock. 
Thereafter, Tycore Ventures, Inc. changed its corporate name to Hondo Minerals 
Corporation.</font></div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">The Company is currently an exploration stage company and will 
continue to be an exploration stage company until we have established mineral 
reserves. There is no assurance that a commercially viable mineral deposit 
exists on any of our properties and further exploration will be required before 
a final evaluation as to the economic and legal feasibility is 
determined.</font></div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman; 
FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: 
bold">II.&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;<font 
style="DISPLAY: inline; TEXT-DECORATION: underline">GLOSSARY</font></font></div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">The following defined technical geological terms (or variations
thereof) are used in our Annual Report:</font></div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify">
<div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 
0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New 
Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&#160;</font></div>
</div>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify">
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify">
<div align="left">
<table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" width="100%" style="FONT-FAMILY: times 
new roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">
<tr>
<td valign="top" width="22%">
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">Term</font></div>
</td>
<td valign="top" width="78%">
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman; 
FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">Definition</font></font></div>
</td>
</tr><tr>
<td valign="top" width="22%">&#160;</td>
<td valign="top" width="78%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times 
new roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&#160; </font></td>
</tr><tr>
<td valign="top" width="22%">
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Amphibole</font></div>
</td>
<td valign="top" width="78%">
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Any of a large group of structurally similar hydrated double 
silicate minerals, such as hornblende, containing various combinations of 
sodium, calcium, magnesium, iron, and aluminum.</font></div>
</td>
</tr><tr>
<td valign="top" width="22%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times 
new roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&#160; </font></td>
<td valign="top" width="78%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times 
new roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&#160; </font></td>
</tr><tr>
<td valign="top" width="22%">
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Andesite</font></div>
</td>
<td valign="top" width="78%">
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Medium to dark coloured vesicular volcanic rocks, mostly fine 
grained with typically porphyric texture.</font></div>
</td>
</tr><tr>
<td valign="top" width="22%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times 
new roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&#160; </font></td>
<td valign="top" width="78%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times 
new roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&#160; </font></td>
</tr><tr>
<td valign="top" width="22%">
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Anticline</font></div>
</td>
<td valign="top" width="78%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times 
new roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">A ridge or ridge-shaped fold of stratified rock in 
which the strata slope downward from the crest.</font></td>
</tr><tr>
<td valign="top" width="22%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times 
new roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&#160; </font></td>
<td valign="top" width="78%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times 
new roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&#160; </font></td>
</tr><tr>
<td valign="top" width="22%">
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Aplite</font></div>
</td>
<td valign="top" width="78%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times 
new roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Light-colored and fine-grained granitic rock 
consisting chiefly of quartz and feldspars.</font></td>
</tr><tr>
<td valign="top" width="22%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times 
new roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&#160; </font></td>
<td valign="top" width="78%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times 
new roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&#160; </font></td>
</tr><tr>
<td valign="top" width="22%">
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Aresenopyrite</font></div>
</td>
<td valign="top" width="78%">
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify">
<div align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Metallic silver-white to steel gray mineral.&#160;&#160;The 
most common arsenic mineral and principal mineralized material of arsenic; 
occurs in many sulfide mineralized material deposits, particularly those 
containing lead, silver, and gold.</font></div>
</div>
</td>
</tr><tr>
<td valign="top" width="22%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times 
new roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&#160; </font></td>
<td valign="top" width="78%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times 
new roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&#160; </font></td>
</tr><tr>
<td valign="top" width="22%">
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Assay</font></div>
</td>
<td valign="top" width="78%">
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman; 
FONT-SIZE: 10pt"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman; 
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">The testing of a metal or mineralized material to determine its
ingredients and quality.</font></font></div>
</td>
</tr><tr>
<td valign="top" width="22%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times 
new roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&#160; </font></td>
<td valign="top" width="78%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times 
new roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&#160; </font></td>
</tr><tr>
<td align="left" valign="top" width="22%">
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman; 
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Batholith</font></div>
</td>
<td valign="top" width="78%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times 
new roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">A very large igneous intrusion extending deep in the
Earth's crust.</font></td>
</tr><tr>
<td valign="top" width="22%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times 
new roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&#160; </font></td>
<td valign="top" width="78%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times 
new roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&#160; </font></td>
</tr><tr>
<td align="left" valign="top" width="22%">
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman; 
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Bedrock</font></div>
</td>
<td align="left" valign="top" width="78%">
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman; 
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">A deposit of solid rock that is typically buried beneath soil 
and other broken or unconsolidated material.</font></div>
</td>
</tr><tr>
<td valign="top" width="22%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times 
new roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&#160; </font></td>
<td valign="top" width="78%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times 
new roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&#160; </font></td>
</tr><tr>
<td align="left" valign="top" width="22%">
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman; 
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Biotite</font></div>
</td>
<td valign="top" width="78%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times 
new roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">A black, dark brown, or greenish black micaceous 
mineral.</font></td>
</tr><tr>
<td valign="top" width="22%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times 
new roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&#160; </font></td>
<td valign="top" width="78%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times 
new roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&#160; </font></td>
</tr><tr>
<td align="left" valign="top" width="22%">
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman; 
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Breccia</font></div>
</td>
<td align="left" valign="top" width="78%">
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman; 
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">A coarse-grained clastic rock, composed of angular broken rock 
fragments held together by a mineral cement or in a fine-grained 
matrix</font></div>
</td>
</tr><tr>
<td valign="top" width="22%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times 
new roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&#160; </font></td>
<td valign="top" width="78%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times 
new roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&#160; </font></td>
</tr><tr>
<td align="left" valign="top" width="22%">
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT:
0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman; 
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Calcite</font></div>
</td>
<td valign="top" width="78%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times 
new roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times new
roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">A mineral composed of calcium carbonate (CaCO<font 
style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 70%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: 
sub">3</font>).</font></font></td>
</tr><tr>
<td valign="top" width="22%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times 
new roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&#160; </font></td>
<td valign="top" width="78%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times 
new roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&#160; </font></td>
</tr><tr>
<td valign="top" width="22%">
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Cenozoic</font></div>
</td>
<td valign="top" width="78%">
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Relating to or denoting the most recent era, following the 
Mesozoic era and comprising the Tertiary and Quaternary periods. The Cenozoic 
period covers the period from approximately 65.5 million years ago to the 
present day.</font></div>
</td>
</tr><tr>
<td valign="top" width="22%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times 
new roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&#160;</font></td>
<td valign="top" width="78%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times 
new roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&#160;</font></td>
</tr><tr>
<td valign="top" width="22%">
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Chalcopyrite</font></div>
</td>
<td valign="top" width="78%">
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify">
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman; 
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">A mineral, a sulfide of copper and iron.</font></div>
</div>
</td>
</tr><tr>
<td valign="top" width="22%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times 
new roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&#160;</font></td>
<td valign="top" width="78%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times 
new roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&#160;</font></td>
</tr><tr>
<td valign="top" width="22%">
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Chlorite</font></div>
</td>
<td valign="top" width="78%">
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">A generally green or black secondary mineral, often formed by 
metamorphic alteration of primary dark rock minerals that appears as a spot of 
green and resembles mica.</font></div>
</td>
</tr></table>
<div>&#160;</div>
<div id="PGBRK" style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt">
<div id="FTR">
<div id="GLFTR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; 
FONT-FAMILY: times new roman; FONT-SIZE: 8pt">&#160; </font></div>
</div>
<div id="PN" style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always; WIDTH: 100%">
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: center; WIDTH: 100%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-
FAMILY: times new roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">4</font></div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: center; WIDTH: 100%">
<hr style="COLOR: black" noshade size="2">
</div>
</div>
<div id="HDR">
<div id="GLHDR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="right"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; 
FONT-FAMILY: times new roman; FONT-SIZE: 8pt">&#160; </font></div>
</div>
</div>
<div>&#160;</div>
<div align="left">
<table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" width="100%" style="FONT-FAMILY: times 
new roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">
<tr>
<td valign="top" width="22%">
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Clastic</font></div>
</td>
<td valign="top" width="78%">
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Denoting rocks composed of broken pieces of older 
rocks.</font></div>
</td>
</tr><tr>
<td valign="top" width="22%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times 
new roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&#160;</font></td>
<td valign="top" width="78%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times 
new roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&#160;</font></td>
</tr><tr>
<td valign="top" width="22%">
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Cretaceous</font></div>
</td>
<td valign="top" width="78%">
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Of, relating to, or denoting the last period of the Mesozoic 
era, between the Jurassic and Tertiary periods. The Cretaceous period lasted 
from about 146 million to 65 million years ago.</font></div>
</td>
</tr><tr>
<td valign="top" width="22%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times 
new roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&#160;</font></td>
<td valign="top" width="78%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times
new roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&#160;</font></td>
</tr><tr>
<td valign="top" width="22%">
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Crystal</font></div>
</td>
<td valign="top" width="78%">
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">A piece of a homogeneous solid substance having a naturally 
geometrically regular form with symmetrically arranged plane faces.</font></div>
</td>
</tr><tr>
<td valign="top" width="22%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times 
new roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&#160;</font></td>
<td valign="top" width="78%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times 
new roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&#160;</font></td>
</tr><tr>
<td align="left" valign="top" width="22%">
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman; 
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Crystalline</font></div>
</td>
<td align="left" valign="top" width="78%">
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman; 
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Of, relating to, or composed of crystals.</font></div>
</td>
</tr><tr>
<td align="left" valign="top" width="22%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-
FAMILY: times new roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&#160;</font></td>
<td align="left" valign="top" width="78%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-
FAMILY: times new roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&#160;</font></td>
</tr><tr>
<td valign="top" width="22%">
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Development Stage</font></div>
</td>
<td valign="top" width="78%">
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Includes all issuers engaged in the preparation of an 
established commercially minable deposit (reserves) for its extraction which are
not in the production stage.</font></div>
</td>
</tr><tr>
<td valign="top" width="22%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times 
new roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&#160;</font></td>
<td valign="top" width="78%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times 
new roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&#160;</font></td>
</tr><tr>
<td valign="top" width="22%">
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Diabase</font></div>
</td>
<td valign="top" width="78%">
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Fine- to medium-grained, dark gray to black intrusive igneous 
rock.</font></div>
</td>
</tr><tr>
<td valign="top" width="22%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times 
new roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&#160; </font></td>
<td valign="top" width="78%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times 
new roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&#160; </font></td>
</tr><tr>
<td valign="top" width="22%">
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Dike</font></div>
</td>
<td valign="top" width="78%">
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">A sheetlike body of igneous rock that cuts across layering or 
contacts in the rock into which it intrudes.</font></div>
</td>
</tr><tr>
<td valign="top" width="22%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times 
new roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&#160; </font></td>
<td valign="top" width="78%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times 
new roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&#160; </font></td>
</tr><tr>
<td valign="top" width="22%">
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Dip</font></div>
</td>
<td valign="top" width="78%">
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">The angle that a rock unit, fault or other rock structure makes
with a horizontal plane. Expressed as the angular difference between the 
horizontal plane and the structure. The angle is measured in a plane 
perpendicular to the strike of the rock structure.</font></div>
</td>
</tr><tr>
<td valign="top" width="22%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times 
new roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&#160; </font></td>
<td valign="top" width="78%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times 
new roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&#160; </font></td>
</tr><tr>
<td valign="top" width="22%">
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Diorite</font></div>
</td>
<td valign="top" width="78%">
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Coarse-grained, intrusive igneous rock that is intermediate in 
composition between granite and gabbro.</font></div>
</td>
</tr><tr>
<td valign="top" width="22%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times 
new roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&#160; </font></td>
<td valign="top" width="78%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times 
new roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&#160; </font></td>
</tr><tr>
<td valign="top" width="22%">
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Dore</font></div>
</td>
<td valign="top" width="78%">
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Unrefined gold and silver bullion bars.</font></div>
</td>
</tr><tr>
<td valign="top" width="22%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times 
new roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&#160; </font></td>
<td valign="top" width="78%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times 
new roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&#160; </font></td>
</tr><tr>
<td valign="top" width="22%">
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Electrowinning</font></div>
</td>
<td valign="top" width="78%">
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Process used to remove metal ions from liquid solutions. Most 
often used to recover precious metals.</font></div>
</td>
</tr><tr>
<td valign="top" width="22%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times 
new roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&#160; </font></td>
<td valign="top" width="78%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times 
new roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&#160; </font></td>
</tr><tr>
<td valign="top" width="22%">
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Exploration Stage</font></div>
</td>
<td valign="top" width="78%">
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Includes all issuers engaged in the search for mineral deposit 
(reserves) which are not in either the development or production 
stage.</font></div>
</td>
</tr><tr>
<td valign="top" width="22%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times 
new roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&#160; </font></td>
<td valign="top" width="78%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times 
new roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&#160; </font></td>
</tr><tr>
<td valign="top" width="22%">
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Extrusive Rock</font></div>
</td>
<td valign="top" width="78%">
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Igneous rocks which form by the crystallization of magma at the
surface of the Earth.</font></div>
</td>
</tr><tr>
<td valign="top" width="22%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times 
new roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&#160; </font></td>
<td valign="top" width="78%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times 
new roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&#160; </font></td>
</tr><tr>
<td valign="top" width="22%">
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Facies</font></div>
</td>
<td valign="top" width="78%">
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">The character of a rock expressed by its formation, 
composition, and fossil content.</font></div>
</td>
</tr><tr>
<td valign="top" width="22%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times 
new roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&#160; </font></td>
<td valign="top" width="78%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times 
new roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&#160; </font></td>
</tr><tr>
<td valign="top" width="22%">
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Fault</font></div>
</td>
<td valign="top" width="78%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times 
new roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">A fracture or fracture zone in rock along which 
movement has occurred.</font></td>
</tr><tr>
<td valign="top" width="22%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times 
new roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&#160; </font></td>
<td valign="top" width="78%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times 
new roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&#160; </font></td>
</tr><tr>
<td valign="top" width="22%">
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Feldspar</font></div>
</td>
<td valign="top" width="78%">
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Any of a group of abundant rock-forming minerals occurring 
principally in igneous, plutonic, and some metamorphic rocks, and consisting of 
silicates of aluminum with potassium, sodium, calcium, and, rarely, 
barium.</font></div>
</td>
</tr><tr>
<td valign="top" width="22%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times 
new roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&#160; </font></td>
<td valign="top" width="78%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times 
new roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&#160; </font></td>
</tr><tr>
<td valign="top" width="22%">
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Fissure</font></div>
</td>
<td valign="top" width="78%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times 
new roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">A long, narrow opening in a rock, made by cracking 
or splitting.</font></td>
</tr><tr>
<td valign="top" width="22%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times 
new roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&#160; </font></td>
<td valign="top" width="78%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times 
new roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&#160; </font></td>
</tr><tr>
<td valign="top" width="22%">
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Foliation</font></div>
</td>
<td valign="top" width="78%">
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">The set of layers visible in many metamorphic rocks as a result
of the flattening and stretching of mineral grains during 
metamorphism.</font></div>
</td>
</tr><tr>
<td valign="top" width="22%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times 
new roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&#160; </font></td>
<td valign="top" width="78%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times 
new roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&#160; </font></td>
</tr><tr>
<td valign="top" width="22%">
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Gabbro</font></div>
</td>
<td valign="top" width="78%">
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">A dark, coarse-grained plutonic rock of crystalline 
texture.</font></div>
</td>
</tr><tr>
<td valign="top" width="22%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times 
new roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&#160; </font></td>
<td valign="top" width="78%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times 
new roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&#160; </font></td>
</tr><tr>
<td valign="top" width="22%">
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Galena</font></div>
</td>
<td valign="top" width="78%">
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify">
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman; 
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">A bluish, gray, or black mineral of metallic appearance, 
consisting of lead sulfide.</font></div>
</div>
</td>
</tr><tr>
<td valign="top" width="22%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times 
new roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&#160; </font></td>
<td valign="top" width="78%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times 
new roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&#160; </font></td>
</tr><tr>
<td valign="top" width="22%">
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Gneiss</font></div>
</td>
<td valign="top" width="78%">
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">A metamorphic rock with a banded or foliated structure, 
typically coarse-grained.</font></div>
</td>
</tr><tr>
<td valign="top" width="22%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times 
new roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&#160; </font></td>
<td valign="top" width="78%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times 
new roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&#160; </font></td>
</tr><tr>
<td valign="top" width="22%">
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Gouge</font></div>
</td>
<td valign="top" width="78%">
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">A layer of soft, earthy or clayey material along the wall of a 
vein.</font></div>
</td>
</tr><tr>
<td valign="top" width="22%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times 
new roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&#160; </font></td>
<td valign="top" width="78%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times 
new roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&#160; </font></td>
</tr><tr>
<td valign="top" width="22%">
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Halide</font></div>
</td>
<td valign="top" width="78%">
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Minerals formed by combining a metal with one of the five 
halogen elements.</font></div>
</td>
</tr><tr>
<td valign="top" width="22%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times 
new roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&#160; </font></td>
<td valign="top" width="78%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times 
new roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&#160; </font></td>
</tr><tr>
<td valign="top" width="22%">
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Hornblende</font></div>
</td>
<td valign="top" width="78%">
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">A green to black amphibolic mineral formed in the late stages 
of cooling in igneous rock.</font></div>
</td>
</tr><tr>
<td valign="top" width="22%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times 
new roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&#160; </font></td>
<td valign="top" width="78%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times 
new roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&#160; </font></td>
</tr><tr>
<td valign="top" width="22%">
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Horse-tailing</font></div>
</td>
<td valign="top" width="78%">
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Gradual splitting.</font></div>
</td>
</tr><tr>
<td valign="top" width="22%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times 
new roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&#160; </font></td>
<td valign="top" width="78%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times 
new roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&#160; </font></td>
</tr><tr>
<td valign="top" width="22%">
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Hydrothermal</font></div>
</td>
<td valign="top" width="78%">
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Of, relating to, or denoting the action of heated water in the 
Earth's crust.</font></div>
</td>
</tr><tr>
<td valign="top" width="22%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times 
new roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&#160; </font></td>
<td valign="top" width="78%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times 
new roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&#160; </font></td>
</tr><tr>
<td valign="top" width="22%">
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Igneous</font></div>
</td>
<td valign="top" width="78%">
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Relating to or involving volcanic processes.</font></div>
</td>
</tr></table>
<div>&#160;</div>
<div id="PGBRK" style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt">
<div id="FTR">
<div id="GLFTR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; 
FONT-FAMILY: times new roman; FONT-SIZE: 8pt">&#160; </font></div>
</div>
<div id="PN" style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always; WIDTH: 100%">
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: center; WIDTH: 100%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-
FAMILY: times new roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">5</font></div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: center; WIDTH: 100%">
<hr style="COLOR: black" noshade size="2">
</div>
</div>
<div id="HDR">
<div id="GLHDR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="right"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; 
FONT-FAMILY: times new roman; FONT-SIZE: 8pt">&#160; </font></div>
</div>
</div>
<div>&#160;</div>
<div align="left">
<div align="left">
<table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" width="100%" style="FONT-FAMILY: times 
new roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">
<tr>
<td valign="top" width="22%">
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Intrusive Rock</font></div>
</td>
<td valign="top" width="78%">
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Igneous rocks which form by the crystallization of magma at a 
depth within the Earth.</font></div>
</td>
</tr><tr>
<td valign="top" width="22%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times 
new roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&#160; </font></td>
<td valign="top" width="78%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times 
new roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&#160; </font></td>
</tr><tr>
<td valign="top" width="22%">
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Jurassic</font></div>
</td>
<td valign="top" width="78%">
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Of, relating to, or denoting the second period of the Mesozoic 
era, between the Triassic and Cretaceous periods. The Jurassic period lasted 
from about 208 million to 146 million years ago.</font></div>
</td>
</tr><tr>
<td valign="top" width="22%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times 
new roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&#160; </font></td>
<td valign="top" width="78%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times 
new roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&#160; </font></td>
</tr><tr>
<td valign="top" width="22%">
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Lamprophyre</font></div>
</td>
<td valign="top" width="78%">
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Any of a group of dark gray to black intrusive igneous rocks 
that generally occur as dikes.</font></div>
</td>
</tr><tr>
<td valign="top" width="22%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times 
new roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&#160; </font></td>
<td valign="top" width="78%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times 
new roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&#160; </font></td>
</tr><tr>
<td valign="top" width="22%">
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Lode</font></div>
</td>
<td valign="top" width="78%">
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT:
0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">A mineral deposit in solid rock.</font></div>
</td>
</tr><tr>
<td valign="top" width="22%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times 
new roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&#160; </font></td>
<td valign="top" width="78%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times 
new roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&#160; </font></td>
</tr><tr>
<td valign="top" width="22%">
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Mafic</font></div>
</td>
<td valign="top" width="78%">
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">A term used to describe an igneous rock that has a large 
percentage of dark-colored minerals such as amphibole, pyroxene and olivine. 
Also used in reference to the magmas from which these rocks crystallize. Mafic 
rocks are generally rich in iron and magnesium.</font></div>
</td>
</tr><tr>
<td valign="top" width="22%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times 
new roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&#160; </font></td>
<td valign="top" width="78%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times 
new roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&#160; </font></td>
</tr><tr>
<td valign="top" width="22%">
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Matrix</font></div>
</td>
<td valign="top" width="78%">
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">The solid matter in which a fossil or crystal is 
embedded.</font></div>
</td>
</tr><tr>
<td valign="top" width="22%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times 
new roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&#160; </font></td>
<td valign="top" width="78%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times 
new roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&#160; </font></td>
</tr><tr>
<td valign="top" width="22%">
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Mesothermal</font></div>
</td>
<td valign="top" width="78%">
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">A mineral deposit formed at moderate temperature and pressure, 
in and along fissures or other openings in rocks, by deposition at intermediate 
depths, from hydrothermal fluids.</font></div>
</td>
</tr><tr>
<td valign="top" width="22%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times 
new roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&#160; </font></td>
<td valign="top" width="78%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times 
new roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&#160; </font></td>
</tr><tr>
<td valign="top" width="22%">
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Mesozoic</font></div>
</td>
<td valign="top" width="78%">
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Of, relating to, or denoting the era between the Paleozoic and 
Cenozoic eras, comprising the Triassic, Jurassic and Cretaceous periods. The 
Mesozoic period lasted from about 252 million to 66 million years 
ago.</font></div>
</td>
</tr><tr>
<td valign="top" width="22%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times 
new roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&#160; </font></td>
<td valign="top" width="78%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times 
new roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&#160; </font></td>
</tr><tr>
<td valign="top" width="22%">
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Metallurgy</font></div>
</td>
<td valign="top" width="78%">
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Domain of materials science that studies the physical and 
chemical behavior of metallic elements, their intermetallic compounds, and their
mixtures, which are called alloys. It is also the technology of metals: the way 
in which science is applied to their practical use.</font></div>
</td>
</tr><tr>
<td valign="top" width="22%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times 
new roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&#160; </font></td>
<td valign="top" width="78%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times 
new roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&#160; </font></td>
</tr><tr>
<td valign="top" width="22%">
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Metamorphic Rock</font></div>
</td>
<td valign="top" width="78%">
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Rock that has undergone a change from its original form due to 
changes in temperature, pressure or chemical alteration.</font></div>
</td>
</tr><tr>
<td valign="top" width="22%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times 
new roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&#160; </font></td>
<td valign="top" width="78%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times 
new roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&#160; </font></td>
</tr><tr>
<td valign="top" width="22%">
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Mica</font></div>
</td>
<td valign="top" width="78%">
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">A shiny silicate mineral with a layered structure, found as 
minute scales in granite and other rocks, or as crystals.</font></div>
</td>
</tr><tr>
<td valign="top" width="22%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times 
new roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&#160; </font></td>
<td valign="top" width="78%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times 
new roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&#160; </font></td>
</tr><tr>
<td valign="top" width="22%">
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Mineral Reserve</font></div>
</td>
<td valign="top" width="78%">
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">That part of a mineral deposit which could be economically and 
legally extracted or produced at the time of the reserve 
determination.</font></div>
</td>
</tr><tr>
<td valign="top" width="22%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times 
new roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&#160;</font></td>
<td valign="top" width="78%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times 
new roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&#160;</font></td>
</tr><tr>
<td valign="top" width="22%">
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&#160;</font></div>
</td>
<td valign="top" width="78%">
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify">
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman; 
FONT-SIZE: 
10pt">1)&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;</font>Prove
n (Measured) Reserves. Reserves for which (a) quantity is computed from 
dimensions revealed in outcrops, trenches, workings or drill holes, grade and/or
quality are computed from the results of detailed sampling and (b) the sites for
inspection, sampling and measurement are spaced so closely and the geologic 
character is so well defined that size, shape, depth and mineral content of 
reserves are well- established.</font></div>
</div>
</td>
</tr><tr>
<td valign="top" width="22%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times 
new roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&#160;</font></td>
<td valign="top" width="78%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times 
new roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&#160;</font></td>
</tr><tr>
<td valign="top" width="22%">
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&#160;</font></div>
</td>
<td valign="top" width="78%">
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify">
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman; 
FONT-SIZE:
10pt">2)</font>&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;Proba
ble (Indicated) Reserves. Reserves for which quantity and grade and/or quality 
are computed from information similar to that used for proven (measured) 
reserves, but the sites for inspection, sampling, and measurement are farther 
apart or are otherwise less adequately spaced. The degree of assurance, although
lower than that for proven (measured) reserves, is high enough to assume 
continuity between points of observation.</font></div>
</div>
</td>
</tr><tr>
<td valign="top" width="22%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times 
new roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&#160; </font></td>
<td valign="top" width="78%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times 
new roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&#160; </font></td>
</tr><tr>
<td valign="top" width="22%">
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Mineralization</font></div>
</td>
<td valign="top" width="78%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times 
new roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">The concentration of metals and their chemical 
compounds within a body of rock.</font></td>
</tr><tr>
<td valign="top" width="22%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times 
new roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&#160; </font></td>
<td valign="top" width="78%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times 
new roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&#160; </font></td>
</tr><tr>
<td valign="top" width="22%">
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Outcrop</font></div>
</td>
<td valign="top" width="78%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times 
new roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">A segment of bedrock exposed to the 
atmosphere.</font></td>
</tr><tr>
<td valign="top" width="22%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times 
new roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&#160; </font></td>
<td valign="top" width="78%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times 
new roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&#160; </font></td>
</tr><tr>
<td valign="top" width="22%">
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Paleozoic</font></div>
</td>
<td valign="top" width="78%">
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Of, relating to, or denoting the era between the Precambrian 
era and the Mesozoic era. The Paleozoic era lasted from about 570 million to 245
million years ago.</font></div>
</td>
</tr><tr>
<td valign="top" width="22%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times 
new roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&#160; </font></td>
<td valign="top" width="78%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times 
new roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&#160; </font></td>
</tr><tr>
<td valign="top" width="22%">
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Pegmatitic</font></div>
</td>
<td valign="top" width="78%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times 
new roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">A coarsely crystalline granite or other igneous rock
with crystals several centimeters in length.</font></td>
</tr><tr>
<td valign="top" width="22%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times 
new roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&#160; </font></td>
<td valign="top" width="78%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times 
new roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&#160; </font></td>
</tr><tr>
<td valign="top" width="22%">
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Porphyry</font></div>
</td>
<td valign="top" width="78%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times 
new roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">A heterogeneous rock characterized by the presence 
of crystals in a relatively finer- grained matrix.</font></td>
</tr></table>
</div>
<div>&#160;</div>
<div id="PGBRK" style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt">
<div id="FTR">
<div id="GLFTR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; 
FONT-FAMILY: times new roman; FONT-SIZE: 8pt">&#160; </font></div>
</div>
<div id="PN" style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always; WIDTH: 100%">
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: center; WIDTH: 100%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-
FAMILY: times new roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">6</font></div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: center; WIDTH: 100%">
<hr style="COLOR: black" noshade size="2">
</div>
</div>
<div id="HDR">
<div id="GLHDR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="right"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; 
FONT-FAMILY: times new roman; FONT-SIZE: 8pt">&#160; </font></div>
</div>
</div>
<div>&#160;</div>
<table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" width="100%" style="FONT-FAMILY: times 
new roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">
<tr>
<td valign="top" width="22%">
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Precambrian</font></div>
</td>
<td valign="top" width="78%">
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Noting or pertaining to the earliest era of earth history, 
ending 570 million years ago, during which the earth's crust formed and life 
first appeared in the seas.</font></div>
</td>
</tr><tr>
<td valign="top" width="22%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times
new roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&#160; </font></td>
<td valign="top" width="78%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times 
new roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&#160; </font></td>
</tr><tr>
<td valign="top" width="22%">
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Production Stage</font></div>
</td>
<td valign="top" width="78%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times 
new roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Includes all issuers engaged in the exploitation of 
a mineral deposit (reserve).</font></td>
</tr><tr>
<td valign="top" width="22%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times 
new roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&#160; </font></td>
<td valign="top" width="78%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times 
new roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&#160; </font></td>
</tr><tr>
<td valign="top" width="22%">
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Pyrite</font></div>
</td>
<td valign="top" width="78%">
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">A common mineral that consists of iron disulfide, has a pale 
brass-yellow color and metallic luster.</font></div>
</td>
</tr><tr>
<td valign="top" width="22%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times 
new roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&#160; </font></td>
<td valign="top" width="78%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times 
new roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&#160; </font></td>
</tr><tr>
<td valign="top" width="22%">
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Pulverize</font></div>
</td>
<td valign="top" width="78%">
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">To reduce (as by crushing or grinding) to very small particles 
(as in fine powder or dust).</font></div>
</td>
</tr><tr>
<td valign="top" width="22%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times 
new roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&#160; </font></td>
<td valign="top" width="78%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times 
new roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&#160; </font></td>
</tr><tr>
<td valign="top" width="22%">
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Quartz</font></div>
</td>
<td valign="top" width="78%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times 
new roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">A mineral whose composition is silicon dioxide. A 
crystalline form of silica.</font></td>
</tr><tr>
<td valign="top" width="22%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times 
new roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&#160; </font></td>
<td valign="top" width="78%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times
new roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&#160; </font></td>
</tr><tr>
<td valign="top" width="22%">
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Quaternary</font></div>
</td>
<td valign="top" width="78%">
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Period of time covering approximately the last two million 
years up to the present day.</font></div>
</td>
</tr><tr>
<td valign="top" width="22%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times 
new roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&#160;</font></td>
<td valign="top" width="78%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times 
new roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&#160;</font></td>
</tr><tr>
<td valign="top" width="22%">
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Rhyolite</font></div>
</td>
<td valign="top" width="78%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times 
new roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">A pale fine-grained volcanic rock of granitic 
composition.</font></td>
</tr><tr>
<td valign="top" width="22%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times 
new roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&#160;</font></td>
<td valign="top" width="78%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times 
new roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&#160;</font></td>
</tr><tr>
<td valign="top" width="22%">
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Schist</font></div>
</td>
<td valign="top" width="78%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times 
new roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">A coarse-grained metamorphic rock that consists of 
layers of different minerals.</font></td>
</tr><tr>
<td valign="top" width="22%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times 
new roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&#160;</font></td>
<td valign="top" width="78%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times 
new roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&#160;</font></td>
</tr><tr>
<td valign="top" width="22%">
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Shear</font></div>
</td>
<td valign="top" width="78%">
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">A strain produced by pressure in the structure of a substance, 
when its layers are laterally shifted in relation to each other.</font></div>
</td>
</tr><tr>
<td valign="top" width="22%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times 
new roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&#160;</font></td>
<td valign="top" width="78%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times 
new roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&#160;</font></td>
</tr><tr>
<td valign="top" width="22%">
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Shear Zone</font></div>
</td>
<td valign="top" width="78%">
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Zone composed of rocks that are more highly strained than rocks
adjacent to the zone.</font></div>
</td>
</tr><tr>
<td valign="top" width="22%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times 
new roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&#160;</font></td>
<td valign="top" width="78%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times 
new roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&#160;</font></td>
</tr><tr>
<td valign="top" width="22%">
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Silica</font></div>
</td>
<td valign="top" width="78%">
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">A hard, unreactive, colorless compound, SiO<font 
style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 70%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: sub">2</font>, that 
occurs as the mineral quartz.</font></div>
</td>
</tr><tr>
<td valign="top" width="22%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times 
new roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&#160;</font></td>
<td valign="top" width="78%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times 
new roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&#160;</font></td>
</tr><tr>
<td valign="top" width="22%">
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Silicate</font></div>
</td>
<td valign="top" width="78%">
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Any of the many minerals consisting of silica combined with 
metal oxides, forming a major component of the rocks of the earth's 
crust.</font></div>
</td>
</tr><tr>
<td valign="top" width="22%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times 
new roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&#160;</font></td>
<td valign="top" width="78%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times 
new roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&#160;</font></td>
</tr><tr>
<td valign="top" width="22%">
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Stock</font></div>
</td>
<td valign="top" width="78%">
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Discordant igneous intrusion having a surface exposure of less 
than 40&#160;square&#160;miles (100&#160;km<font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-
SIZE: 70%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: text-top">2</font>), differing from batholiths only
in being smaller.</font></div>
</td>
</tr><tr>
<td valign="top" width="22%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times 
new roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&#160;</font></td>
<td valign="top" width="78%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times 
new roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&#160;</font></td>
</tr><tr>
<td valign="top" width="22%">
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Strain</font></div>
</td>
<td valign="top" width="78%">
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">A change in the volume or shape of a rock mass in response to 
stress.</font></div>
</td>
</tr><tr>
<td valign="top" width="22%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times 
new roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&#160;</font></td>
<td valign="top" width="78%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times 
new roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&#160;</font></td>
</tr><tr>
